Title: (Updated) Realtime voice is now available in M365 Copilot Chat and M365 Copilot
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: Realtime voice chat is now available in Microsoft 365 Copilot, enabling hands-free, natural interactions for brainstorming, searching, and more. The feature rolls out worldwide starting September 2025, is on by default, requires no admin setup, and supports iOS, Android, Web, Windows, and Mac platforms.

Title: (Updated) Multiple account access to Copilot in Microsoft 365 desktop and mobile apps
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Starting March 2025, Microsoft 365 will allow multiple account access to Copilot in desktop and mobile apps, enabling users to use Copilot on any permitted document across accounts. Enterprise data protection applies based on file access identity. Admins can restrict this via a Cloud Policy available by January 2025.

Title: New support for HR and employee profile data in Microsoft 365 Copilot connectors
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft 365 Copilot now supports HR and employee profile data via connectors like BambooHR and custom Microsoft Graph connectors, enhancing people profiles with authoritative external data. Administrators configure these in the Admin Center. Public preview runs mid-May to mid-November 2025; general availability starts mid-November 2025.

Title: (Updated) NEW Microsoft 365 companion apps: a suite designed to enhance productivity
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Starting late October 2025, Microsoft 365 companion apps—People, Files, and Calendar—will auto-install on Windows 11 devices with Microsoft 365 apps, integrating Copilot for contextual AI assistance. Admins can opt out via Device Configuration. Apps enhance productivity by streamlining access to contacts, files, and meetings.

Title: (Updated) Use Microsoft Copilot in Word to create, edit, and transform content directly from chat
Summary: Microsoft 365 Copilot in Word introduces Agent Mode for conversational content creation and editing, rolling out worldwide from October to November 2025. Licensed users can draft, reorganize, and revise content directly on the Word canvas, with no admin action required. Compliance review is advised.

Title: (Updated) AI actions coming to SharePoint document libraries
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: AI file actions, currently in OneDrive, will be added to SharePoint document libraries by late 2025, allowing users with Copilot licenses to summarize, compare, and interact with files via natural language. The feature is on by default, requires no admin setup, and includes compliance and audit logging controls.

Title: (Updated) Intelligent Recap Access for Multi-tenant Organization
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: Copilot users in multi-tenant business-to-business organizations will soon access intelligent meeting recaps from the resource tenant after meetings. Rollout starts early November 2025, completing by late November. No action is needed from admins or users for this update.

Title: Microsoft 365 Copilot Apps installation on devices with Microsoft 365 Apps
Tags: Feature update, User impact, Admin impact
Services: Microsoft 365 apps, Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365), Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat
Summary: Starting October 2025, Microsoft will automatically install the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on Windows devices with Microsoft 365 desktop apps, except in the EEA. The app appears in the Start menu, enabled by default, with admins able to opt out and prepare users accordingly.
